PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Thermoplastic Composites Forming Technology for Complex and Integrated Aerospace Components
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The majority of aerospace composite structures are currently manufactured in autoclaves. This process is most cost effective for large, geometrically simple structures like wing and fuselage skins. For geometrically complex parts such as frames or ribs, complex layups with thickness and orientation variations significantly increase the component costs. New fast and low-cost manufacturing technologies have to be investigated as large number of these types of complex structures will be manufactured in large quantities in a near future. Compression moulding (CM) is a process that encompasses several different moulding technologies differentiated by the material form used, the tooling and pressure application. The short processing time may give CM an advantage over other manufacturing techniques and it lends itself well to the manufacture of complex 3D parts. Recent developments of directional fibre and/or carbon fibre sheet molding compound with long discontinuous fibres have allowed application of CM to structural parts. Furthermore, the emergence of thermoplastic matrix composites could further reduce the processing time and enhance the recyclability of aerospace components. This project is part of the fourth round of the CRIAQ (Consortium for Research and Innovation in Aerospace in Qu�bec) and involves five universities, McGill, The University of British Columbia (UBC), Universit� du Qu�bec � Trois-Rivi�res (UQTR), Universit� Laval, Ecole de Technologie Sup�rieure (ETS); three National Research Council Research Centers, the Institute of Aerospace Research Structures,Materials and Propulsion Laboratory (NRC-IAR-SMPL), the Aerospace Manufacturing Technologies Center (NRC-IAR-AMTC), the Industrial Material Institute (NRC-IMI); one professional research center, the ?Centre de d�velopement des composites du Qu�bec? (CDCQ) and six industrial partners, Bell Helicopter Textron Canada, Bombardier, Pratt & Whitney Canada, Hutchinson Industries , Avior Integrated Products and Delastek. The main objective of this project is to develop analytical tools and protocols for the design, analysis and manufacturing for forming of thermoplastic composites for aerospace components

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AI Platform for NDT 4.0: application in automotive and in infrastructure industries
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Analysis of structural imperfections of materials, spare parts or components of a system, is important in the prevention of malfunctioning devices. This can be done by active thermography, which, besides non-destructive testing, has several other applications such as structural health monitoring, material characterization, or thermal imaging in medicine. In thermographic imaging, the specimen is heated up by flash-lamps, lasers, etc., then the corresponding temperature evolution is measured on its surface. The resulting thermal pattern is used to reconstruct the heat distribution inside the material, which provides the main information for detecting defects. In a general way, every author working with thermography has to deal with image
processing issues. In this project, approaches based on artificial intelligence will be developed for infrared thermography inspection. It will be especially applied in automotive and in infrastructure industries.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FERNANDES, H. C.;FERNANDES, HENRIQUE C.;FERNANDES, HENRIQUE C;FERNANDES, HENRIQUE;FERNANDES, HENRIQUE-COELHO;FERNANDES, H.;HENRIQUE FERNANDES;FERNANDES, HENRIQUE COELHO

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Three-dimensional qualitative and quantitative analysis of infrared thermography for non-destructive testing and evaluation of metals and composite materials in on-site inspections based on time-lapsed thermography
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In this project, Time-Lapse Thermography will be applied in the inspection and quantitative characterization of damages in metals and composite materials in components used in the wind energy production (wind turbine blades) and in the automotive industries. In this sense, in order to achieve the best results, a framework will be proposed and will put to the test, which merges results obtained from two-dimensional infrared imaging (IRT-2D) obtained from on-site inspections and three-dimensional computational imaging (3D vision) of the test components. Subsequently, virtual patterns of IRT-3D will be generated allowing accurate characterization of geometry, dimensions and depth damages detected in the inspected samples.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ComLab#4: Smart New Worlds: How AI, Robotics and Digitalisation Transform our Lives
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Humboltian (winner) in the 4th Communication Lab for Exchange (https://www.humboldt-foundation.de/entdecken/organisation/comlab4-smarte-neue-welten-wie-ki-robotik-und-digitalisierung-unser-leben-veraendern) between Research and Media: Twice a year, ten Humboldt Fellows meet up with ten early-career journalists from around the world. The ten journalists are selected by the International Journalists? Programmes organization (IJP e.V.) In teams of two they work on a piece of journalism during the course of a three- to four-day workshop. Highly qualified mentors supervise the process. During these workshops, participants discuss what they expect from one another, how close cooperation works, and what constitutes good research communication. Promoted by the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation in Germany
